a69C7k_9o0koIlMJg3Jd6A.text: Home-cooked food style. Reasonable price. Tasty. Fast service.Always come here for "fast food".All home-cooked. Traditional teochew fare.

FxGmByfqiIwIC-I96nezgw.text: Been here since the dawn of civilization :).  Sadly the standard have gone from bad to worst.  Ok prices are reasonable and one good news is younger staff are taking over.  Perhaps was just there at the wrong time 6:20 on a Friday?

jARbgRV2xbXbn8O81jC_Cg.text: The food is fresh and it gets crowded after 6pm. Many people will drop by either to dine in or take out.Being a half Teochew, I will say the fare is common in my home and maybe that is why growing up, we usually do not dine out at Teochew porridge place. This is probably the 3rd or 4th time in my life that I have actually ate in such a place. I would say it is good wholesome food which is very familiar to home. So if you or your family hardly cook, then this place is a Godsend. But if you get such food at home all the time, it is not impressive, and you definitely will think twice about spending $20 for 2 persons for a plate of fish, mei cai kou rou, 2 meat fishballs, cold tofu, braised tofu and hard boiled eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore. Pork fish ball, cold tofu, fish and mei cai. $15 include a bowl of rice and a bowl of porridge

auirjBGC6UMEW9jozrm8qA.text: We picked up a friend from the airport, and we were hankering for some comfort food... and suddenly, a brainwave - TEOCHEW PORRIDGE.Now everyone has their regular spots, and mine is currently the not-so-convenient Beo Crecsent, so after sent the fella home for a shower, we hunted down the nearest one with a decent rep, and this was it.Looks pretty impressive from the outside - they have two shops side by side okay!? - and when we sauntered in, I was impressed by the clientele (lots of old people), and the counter looked pretty massive, even from a distance. As I walked up to order, the authentic experience kicked in: the uncle spoke to me in Teochew, and I had no idea what was going on. I gingerly started in my stuttering Chinese, with the occasional Hokkien (I know, wrong dialect, but that's as close as I can get), and then the girlfriend came to the rescue; she of Teochew origins (on her mother's side), with the brave and direct pointing and nodding. If only I'd known...To be honest, the selection didn't look so hot, and maybe it was the unfamiliarity, or maybe it was just full of stuff that I didn't eat - I'm not Teochew at all, so this is my usual palate/cuisine.In any case, we over-ordered the pre-requisite amount that we do, and while the food was all tasty, I couldn't help but have a longing for my Beo - and I felt like I was cheating on my food! Horrible feeling, let me tell you, but it was what it was.Glad to say I've tried this one, but my heart belongs to another.

photos.caption: Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore

qPX3dfEazGThtoiZHQpvpQ.text: My to-go-to teochew porridge place. You will be spoilt for choice with the wide variety of dishes to choice from.

CFondae0huM6Vx2SqL3dQg.text: First and foremost, this is my first review here and a little background is I came here with a craving for Teochew porridge. So once here, the food here i find in terms of portion for 2 is lesser than say if we had in Bukit timah Teochew porridge. But this doesn't really concern is as we can order more dishes, saw someone order the "Chang" before us while in q and we decided to order also. So the person reccomened "da Chang" and we realize that we don't like the taste of it. As for the rest of the food we find it slightly above average. (Remember we were hungry in the first place) one thing to note is that the drinks stall sells "Cheng ting" in a cup and some other Chinese drinks. Which is a plus point for me. All in all, we ordered: bittergoud, fish (Chang Yu), lala, and the "da Chang" is 19.50 with two porridge and a rice. Realize that the portion is small I added a fried beancurb and a porridge which is 1.50. So total is 21 dollars. (Will attach some photos if I can. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore. Note on the opening hours here
Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Ah Seah Teochew Porridge - Singapore, Singapore. The dishes that I ordered, $19.50 for all

xFZoXwLXNB1st57iQQfktQ.text: I LOVE teochew porridge. I can't say this enough but I think this passion was probably cultivated from years of sitting around the dining table, with a whole spread of dishes before me - my chopsticks hovering mid-air, uncertain what to to add to my steaming hot bowl of porridge.My family shifts their loyalty every few years from one Teochew porridge stall to another for some strange reason that I am not let in on. And for the past two years, it's been Ah Seah. It's quite hard to review the the dishes at this stall because there are just too many of them. Expect the usual fare of fresh steamed fish, duck simmered in dark sauce and soft cabbage stew - they do it quite like how a grandmother would make them, and that's a thumbs up. Bring a whole group along, that's the best (and possibly the only) way to get the most out of having Teochew porridge.

kZmmh74BX55F36DYDqkB_g.text: The best teochew porridge eating place in this part of the region. Price is reasonable.
